<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 14"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Hand of the Lich](/Feats.aspx?ID=3516) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Book of the Dead](/Sources.aspx?ID=118) pg. 51</row>

**Archetype** [Lich](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=179)

**Prerequisites**
[Lich Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3513)

</column>

---

Negative energy intensifies your undead form and makes your very touch the antithesis of life. You gain the [advanced undead benefits](/Rules.aspx?ID=1695). The damage die for your fist increases to 1d6 instead of 1d4, it deals negative damage instead of bludgeoning damage, and it loses the [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) trait. Your fist becomes [magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103).

 When you critically hit a living creature with your fist Strike, the creature is [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) until the end of your next turn unless it succeeds at a Fortitude save against your spell DC. This is a [critical specialization effect](/Rules.aspx?ID=235).
name: Hand of the Lich
